titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Michael Martin Fennell Papers MC.142
titlestmt.author: Jennifer E. Neal

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 14:38:25 -0500.

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: New York University. Office of University Development and Alumni Relations

did.abstract: Michael Martin Fennel, New York University (NYU) alumnus, bequeathed $4.6 million in circa 1995 to establish the Martin F. Reddington Scholarship at NYU. The scholarship benefits students with financial needs who want to participate in NYU's undergraduate programs abroad. Materials in this collection include a photograph of Martin F. Reddington, a graduation photograph of Michael Martin Fennel, and two drafts of Fennel's article, "Our Lady of the Trenches."
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from Alan Shapiro, Director of Gift Planning, Office for University Development, in 1995. The accession number associated with this collection is 95.032.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Michael Martin Fennel graduated from Washington Square College in 1965. He remained as a student in the English department and received his Master's Degree in 1967. Fennel wrote and published essays and short stories. His grandfather, Martin F. Reddington, one of the pioneers of modern advertising in the 1920s, believed in the importance of higher education. Reddington's passion for higher education inspired Fennel to establish a scholarship fund at New York University to help students in need study abroad.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Michael Martin Fennell Papers; MC 142; box number; folder number; Repository Name, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In December 2018, the photograph of Martin F. Reddington was removed from the frame and placed in a new, acid-free folder. The graduation photograph of Michael Martin Fennel that was originally removed from the collection and placed in the New York University Archives Photograph Collection was reintegrated. All materials were rehoused in a legal size half manuscript box.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this collection include a photograph of Martin F. Reddington, a graduation photograph of Michael Martin Fennel, and two drafts of Fennel's article, "Our Lady of the Trenches." The articles provide an example of Michal Martin Fennel's writing style.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
